title: Comprehensive UX Enhancement Package: Loading States, Tournament Experience, Navigation, Visual Polish, and Enhanced Sponsor Visibility

requirements.summary: Implement skeleton loading screens across all major pages that display content structure placeholders while data is being fetched
acceptanceCriteria: Each major page displays a skeleton screen with placeholder boxes matching the page's content layout
Skeleton screens appear immediately when navigating to a page before data loads
Skeleton animations provide visual feedback that content is loading
Once data loads, skeleton screens smoothly transition to actual content

file_operations.description: Create a reusable SkeletonCard component with animated pulse effects using Tailwind's animate-pulse utility, supporting various sizes and layouts for cards, lists, and content blocks
Create a flexible SkeletonLoader component that can render different skeleton patterns (list, grid, form, dashboard) based on props, with smooth fade transitions
Add skeleton loading state that displays 6 skeleton tournament cards in a grid layout while tournaments data is being fetched, transitioning smoothly to actual content once loaded
Add skeleton loading state showing placeholder for header section, stats grid, and comments section while tournament details are being fetched
Add skeleton loading state displaying placeholder rows for the leaderboard table with rank, player name, and stats columns
Add skeleton loading state showing placeholders for profile header, stats cards, and tournament history list
Add skeleton loading state with placeholders for balance card, action buttons, and transaction list items
Add skeleton loading state displaying placeholder notification items in a vertical list
Add skeleton loading state showing placeholders for overview stat cards and chart areas
Add skeleton loading state with placeholders for squad card, member list, and invitations section
Add skeleton loading state showing placeholders for referral code card, stats cards, and referral list
Add skeleton loading state displaying placeholders for admin tabs and dashboard content panels

requirements.summary: Create helpful and specific error messages throughout the application that clearly explain what went wrong and provide actionable next steps
acceptanceCriteria: Error messages clearly state what went wrong in user-friendly language
Each error message includes actionable guidance on how to resolve the issue
Error styling is consistent across all components using toast notifications or inline error displays
Critical errors are distinguished from warnings with appropriate visual hierarchy

file_operations.description: Create a utility module that maps error types (network, authentication, validation, backend operation failures) to user-friendly error messages with actionable guidance
Create an ErrorDisplay component that shows contextual error messages with icons, severity levels (error, warning, info), and optional retry/action buttons
Update React Query hooks to use the errorMessages utility for consistent error handling across all backend calls, displaying helpful toast notifications on failures
Replace generic error alerts with specific error messages using ErrorDisplay component for registration failures, showing reasons like insufficient balance, tournament full, or profile incomplete
Add inline ErrorDisplay components for deposit/withdrawal form validation errors and transaction failures with clear guidance
Enhance validation error messages for profile setup form fields to be more descriptive and helpful

requirements.summary: Design empty state screens for all list and collection views with relevant illustrations, helpful text, and clear call-to-action buttons
acceptanceCriteria: Each empty state displays a relevant icon or illustration
Empty state text clearly explains why the section is empty and what users can do
Call-to-action buttons guide users toward populating the empty section
Empty states match the gaming theme with consistent styling

file_operations.description: Create a reusable EmptyState component that displays an icon, heading, description text, and optional call-to-action button with dark gaming theme styling
Add EmptyState component when no tournaments match the current filters, with message 'No tournaments found' and a Clear Filters button

Add EmptyState component using the notification bell icon from frontend/public/assets/generated/notification-bell.dim_32x32.png when no notifications exist, with message 'No notifications yet' and helpful text about receiving tournament updates

Add EmptyState component using the wallet icon from frontend/public/assets/generated/wallet-icon.dim_128x128.png when transaction list is empty, with message 'No transactions yet' and description about deposits and winnings
Add EmptyState component when user has no squad, with message 'You haven't joined a squad yet' and a Create Squad button

Add EmptyState component using the trophy icon from frontend/public/assets/generated/trophy-icon.dim_128x128.png when leaderboard has no data for the selected time period, with message 'No rankings available yet'
Add EmptyState component when user has no referrals, with message 'No referrals yet' and description encouraging users to share their referral code

requirements.summary: Add success animations and visual feedback for key user actions using smooth fade-in animations, checkmark icons, and celebratory micro-interactions
acceptanceCriteria: Success animations appear immediately after completing key actions
Animations are smooth, brief (under 1 second), and non-blocking
Success feedback includes visual indicators like checkmarks or glow effects
Animations are consistent across all success scenarios throughout the app

file_operations.description: Create a SuccessAnimation component that displays a checkmark icon with scale and fade-in animations, optional confetti or glow effects, and auto-dismisses after 800ms
Create a SuccessToast component that wraps toast notifications with success-specific styling including neon green glow effects and smooth slide-in animations
Add SuccessAnimation overlay when tournament registration completes successfully, followed by a success toast with registration confirmation details
Add SuccessAnimation when profile is saved successfully, then close modal with fade-out transition
Add SuccessAnimation for successful deposit/withdrawal submissions with neon cyan glow effect
Add SuccessAnimation when squad is created successfully before closing the modal
Add subtle success feedback (small checkmark fade-in) when comment is posted successfully
Add SuccessAnimation when admin creates a tournament successfully

requirements.summary: Enhance mobile responsiveness across all pages by improving touch targets, optimizing layouts for small screens, and ensuring all interactive elements work on mobile
acceptanceCriteria: All buttons and interactive elements have minimum 44px touch targets on mobile
Layouts automatically stack vertically on screens smaller than 768px
Text remains readable at default mobile zoom levels without horizontal scrolling
Navigation menu collapses into a mobile-friendly format on small screens
All forms and modals are fully functional and usable on phone screens

file_operations.description: Implement mobile-responsive header with hamburger menu button for screens under 768px, collapsing navigation links into a slide-out drawer or dropdown menu with minimum 44px touch targets
Create a MobileNav component that renders a slide-out navigation drawer for mobile devices with large touch-friendly navigation items and close button
Ensure all buttons and interactive elements within tournament cards have minimum 44px height on mobile, adjust padding and font sizes for better mobile readability
Optimize filter controls for mobile with larger touch targets, stack filter options vertically on small screens, and ensure all filter buttons are easily tappable
Ensure layout stacks vertically on mobile, registration button spans full width with 44px height, and all content sections are properly spaced for mobile viewing
Stack deposit and withdrawal cards vertically on mobile, ensure form inputs have adequate height (minimum 40px) and touch-friendly spacing
Ensure modal is fully responsive on mobile screens with proper padding, full-width buttons with 44px height, and scrollable content if needed
Optimize modal for mobile screens with responsive padding, full-width form controls, and touch-friendly button sizing
Add global CSS utility classes for mobile-responsive touch targets (min-h-[44px]) and adjust base font sizes for optimal mobile readability

requirements.summary: Redesign TournamentCard component to show visual information at a glance with game mode icons, highlighted prize pool, slot availability indicators, and status badges
acceptanceCriteria: Tournament cards display game mode with custom icons for Solo/Duo/Squad
Prize pool is prominently displayed with neon glow effect matching the gaming theme
Slot availability shows visual progress bar indicating remaining slots
Entry fee is clearly visible with BDT currency formatting
Tournament status (Open/Full/Started/Completed) uses color-coded badges

file_operations.description: Redesign card layout to prominently display prize pool with neon green glow effect using text-shadow and larger font size, add game mode icons (trophy, users, users-group) for Solo/Duo/Squad modes, add a horizontal progress bar showing slot availability (green when >50%, orange when 25-50%, red when <25%), display entry fee with BDT currency formatting, and add color-coded status badge (green for Open, orange for Full, cyan for Started, gray for Completed)
Create a reusable ProgressBar component with dynamic color theming (green/orange/red) based on percentage, smooth width transitions, and gaming-themed styling
Create a StatusBadge component that renders color-coded badges for tournament status with neon glow effects matching the status color
Create utility functions for formatting currency (BDT), numbers, dates, and slot availability text throughout the application

requirements.summary: Streamline tournament registration flow by reducing clicks, pre-filling information, and showing confirmation with room details in a prominent modal
acceptanceCriteria: Tournament registration completes in maximum 2 clicks for users with complete profiles
Registration button directly triggers the registration flow without intermediate modals
Success confirmation appears immediately with tournament details
Room ID and password are displayed in an easy-to-read modal with copy buttons
Each registration step provides clear visual feedback on progress

file_operations.description: Simplify registration button to directly call registration mutation when clicked (no intermediate confirmation modal), show loading state on button during registration, and on success immediately open RegistrationSuccessModal with room details

Create a RegistrationSuccessModal that displays tournament name, start time, room ID and password with large readable text and individual copy-to-clipboard buttons for room ID and password, using neon green success theme
Update registerForTournament mutation to include optimistic updates and return room credentials immediately for display in success modal

requirements.summary: Add clear visual status indicators to tournament cards and detail pages showing Open, Full, Started, and Completed statuses with color-coded badges and icons
acceptanceCriteria: Each tournament status uses distinct color coding: green for Open, orange for Full, cyan for Started, gray for Completed
Status badges include both text labels and icons for quick recognition
Status is prominently displayed on both tournament cards and detail pages
Status indicators match the gaming theme with neon-style styling

file_operations.description: Add StatusBadge component display in top-right corner of card with appropriate color based on tournament status, using text-shadow for neon glow effect
Add large StatusBadge component prominently in the header section below tournament title, with matching neon glow effects

Ensure StatusBadge component supports all four status types (Open, Full, Started, Completed) with color mapping: green (#10b981) for Open, orange (#f97316) for Full, cyan (#06b6d4) for Started, gray (#6b7280) for Completed, each with corresponding neon glow text-shadow effects

requirements.summary: Improve visibility of remaining slots and registration deadlines with fraction format, progress bars, countdown timers, and urgent highlighting
acceptanceCriteria: Remaining slots show both numeric fraction and visual progress bar
Registration deadline displays countdown timer with human-readable format
Low slot availability (under 25% remaining) triggers warning styling
Near deadline (under 24 hours) triggers urgent color highlighting
Slot and deadline information is prominently positioned on cards and detail pages

file_operations.description: Add slot availability display with fraction format (e.g., '8/20 slots') and ProgressBar component below it, apply warning styling (orange glow) when slots remaining < 25%, add countdown timer for registration deadline using human-readable format (e.g., '2h 15m'), apply urgent styling (red glow) when deadline is within 24 hours
Add prominent slot availability section with large fraction display, wide ProgressBar, and deadline countdown timer in the hero section, apply same warning/urgent styling rules as cards
Create a custom hook that calculates time remaining until a target date and returns human-readable countdown text (e.g., '2 hours 15 minutes', '30 minutes', 'Closing soon'), updates every minute
Add utility functions for calculating slot availability percentage and determining if slots are low (<25%) or deadline is urgent (<24 hours)

requirements.summary: Reorganize the Header navigation menu for better information architecture by grouping features and prioritizing frequently accessed pages
acceptanceCriteria: Primary navigation includes most frequently accessed pages: Tournaments, Wallet, Profile, Leaderboard
Secondary features are grouped in a dropdown or sub-menu
Navigation labels clearly describe their destination
Menu structure reduces cognitive load with logical grouping
Mobile navigation adapts the same structure for small screens

file_operations.description: Restructure navigation to show primary links (Tournaments, Wallet, Profile, Leaderboard) directly in the header, move secondary features (Squads, Referrals, Statistics) into a 'More' dropdown menu, ensure navigation labels are concise and descriptive
Create a MoreMenu dropdown component that displays secondary navigation items (Squads, Referrals, Statistics) with icons and labels, using consistent styling with the main navigation
Update mobile navigation to reflect the same structure with primary items listed first, followed by a divider and secondary items

requirements.summary: Enhance search and filter UX on TournamentDashboard with larger touch targets, real-time result count, visual feedback, and clear all button
acceptanceCriteria: Filter controls have minimum 44px touch targets for mobile usability
Result count updates in real-time as users adjust filters
Active filters are visually highlighted with badges or indicators
Clear All Filters button appears when any filter is active
Filter panel layout adapts gracefully for mobile screens

file_operations.description: Increase button and input heights to minimum 44px, add real-time filtered result count display (e.g., 'Showing 8 of 24 tournaments'), highlight active filter buttons with neon accent borders and background glow, add 'Clear All Filters' button that appears when any filter is active, optimize layout for mobile with vertical stacking
Wire the Clear All Filters functionality to reset all filter state, ensure result count updates immediately as filters change using the filtered tournament list length
Add a resetFilters function that clears all filter criteria, ensure filtered count calculation is exposed for display in the UI

requirements.summary: Add shortcuts and quick access features to frequently used sections via a Quick Actions floating menu optimized for mobile thumb reach
acceptanceCriteria: Quick actions menu is accessible from all major pages
Menu includes shortcuts to: My Tournaments, Register, Wallet, Notifications
Button placement is optimized for mobile thumb reach (bottom-right corner)
Quick actions are visually distinct but not intrusive

file_operations.description: Create a floating action button (FAB) positioned in bottom-right corner with neon cyan accent, clicking it expands a radial menu showing quick shortcuts with icons and labels: My Tournaments (filter current user's tournaments), Register (navigate to tournaments), Wallet (navigate to wallet page), Notifications (navigate to notifications page)
Include QuickActionsMenu component in the layout so it appears on all pages, positioned with fixed placement at bottom-right (right-4 bottom-4) with z-index above other content
Ensure AppLayout with QuickActionsMenu is rendered on all routes so quick actions are available throughout the application

requirements.summary: Streamline wallet transaction flow with simplified forms, visual feedback for pending transactions, better categorization, and clear transaction details
acceptanceCriteria: Deposit and withdrawal forms require only essential fields
Pending transactions display with clear pending status badges and visual indicators

file_operations.description: Simplify deposit form to require only amount field, simplify withdrawal form to require amount and payment method fields, add visual pending status indicators (pulsing badge) for any pending transactions at top of page

Add filter buttons (All, Deposits, Withdrawals, Winnings, Fees) above transaction list to filter by type, ensure each transaction displays clear type label, formatted date, status badge (completed/pending/failed), and consistently formatted amount with BDT currency using the formatters utility
Create a TransactionFilters component with button group for filtering transactions by type, with active filter button highlighted
Ensure currency formatter consistently formats BDT amounts with proper comma separators and 'BDT' label

requirements.summary: Implement smooth page transitions throughout the application using fade-in animations for routes, slide-in for modals, and hardware-accelerated 60fps performance
acceptanceCriteria: Page transitions use fade-in effect with 200-300ms duration
Modals slide in from center with scale and opacity animation
Content loaded asynchronously fades in smoothly

file_operations.description: Wrap router outlet with a transition wrapper that applies fade-in animation (opacity 0 to 1, duration 250ms) when routes change, using CSS transforms for hardware acceleration
Create a PageTransition component that wraps page content and applies smooth fade-in animation using Tailwind's transition utilities with transform: translateZ(0) for hardware acceleration
Create a ModalTransition wrapper component for all modals that applies slide-in from center with scale (0.95 to 1) and opacity (0 to 1) animations over 200ms, using hardware-accelerated transforms
Wrap modal content with ModalTransition component for smooth entry/exit animations
Wrap modal content with ModalTransition component for smooth entry/exit animations
Wrap modal content with ModalTransition component for smooth entry/exit animations
Add global CSS animation keyframes for page transitions, modal animations, and content fade-ins, ensuring all animations use transform and opacity for 60fps GPU-accelerated performance

requirements.summary: Improve contrast and readability across all UI components to meet WCAG AA standards with increased font sizes for critical information
acceptanceCriteria: All text meets WCAG AA contrast requirements against backgrounds
Important information uses larger font sizes (18px+ for titles, 16px+ for body)
Neon accent colors are used decoratively while maintaining readable text
Interactive elements have clear visual boundaries with sufficient contrast
Font weights are adjusted for optimal readability on dark backgrounds

file_operations.description: Update CSS color variables to ensure all text colors meet WCAG AA contrast ratio (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text) against dark backgrounds, increase base font size from 14px to 16px for better body text readability, adjust neon accent colors to be used only for decorative glows and borders, not for primary text

Increase prize pool font size to text-3xl (30px) with font-bold, increase entry fee font size to text-lg (18px), ensure all text has sufficient contrast against dark card background, use neon glow effects only on decorative elements
Increase tournament title font size to text-4xl (36px), increase section headings to text-2xl (24px), ensure all body text uses at least text-base (16px), verify all text meets contrast requirements
Update color palette to include WCAG AA compliant text colors for dark backgrounds, adjust neon colors to be used only for accents, ensure primary text color has minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio

requirements.summary: Apply consistent spacing and alignment across all pages and components using a unified 4px base spacing system
acceptanceCriteria: All spacing uses 4px base unit (spacing scale: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 32)

file_operations.description: Define CSS custom properties for standardized spacing scale (--spacing-1: 4px, --spacing-2: 8px, --spacing-4: 16px, --spacing-6: 24px, --spacing-8: 32px), standardize component heights (--button-height: 44px, --input-height: 40px)
Apply consistent padding using p-4 on mobile and p-6 on desktop, ensure all internal spacing between elements uses standardized gap values (gap-4 for main content, gap-2 for related items)
Apply consistent section spacing using space-y-6 for major sections, space-y-4 for subsections, p-6 padding on containers
Standardize card padding (p-6), form field spacing (space-y-4), and button heights (h-11 = 44px)
Apply consistent form spacing (space-y-4 between fields), button heights (h-11), and modal padding (p-6)
Verify and document the spacing scale in the Tailwind config, ensure all spacing utilities align with the 4px base unit system
